channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pedestrian crossing outside Sainsbury's, 4th February
item.description:
The defect that used to be apparent here has returned. When the button is pressed on the Sainsbury side the wait signal lights up but it goes out after about 40 seconds, without turning the crossing to green for people to cross. When people notice they press the button again and the cycle repeats. This carried on until someone pressed from the other side of the road. Total wait time this evening approx 1 and a half minutes (I counted the seconds).
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34-48, London Road, Forest Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parking outside 81 Boundary Road, 4th February
item.description:
I am writing to formally request that the Council consider introducing parking restrictions on Boundary Road, DA15 8SS. Parking problems on this road have become increasingly worse over the past year. Many residents are affected by vehicles that do not belong to local households being left parked for days at a time. These include cars, vans, and lorries from people living on nearby roads and surrounding areas, which significantly reduces available parking for residents. Of particular concern is the number of lorries and large vans parking in marked bays and on road corners. This restricts visibility for drivers and pedestrians, creating a very dangerous situation, especially at junctions and bends. The ongoing congestion also causes difficulties for visitors, deliveries, and access for emergency services. A large number of neighbours are affected by this issue, and it is having a negative impact on both safety and quality of life for residents. I would therefore be grateful if the Council could review the situation and advise whether measures such as permit parking, time-limited parking, or other suitable restrictions could be introduced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, Boundary Road, Falconwood, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of potholes. Very dangerous., 4th February
item.description:
The road is so bad that when buses pass our house shakes (21 Summers Lane). Cracks are appearing in our walls. Holes on both sides of the road from the eastbound bus stop (from number 13 Summers Lane) to past the road to Glebelands, on both sides

item.title: Hazardous waste at 196 Herbert Road, 4th February
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Herbert Road, Woolwich
